"><subfield code="a">The results from the initial exposure of the MINOS detectors to neutrinos produced by the Fermilab NuMI beam are reported here. The exposure consisted of 1.27x10²° 120 GeV protons incident on the NuMI target. The data show the observation of 215 neutrinos with energies below 30 GeV while 336 ± 14.4 events were expected. The data are consistent with ν{sub μ} disappearance via neutrino oscillations with </subfield><subfield code=" ">= 2.74{sub +0.44}{sup -0.26} x 10⁻³ eV²/c⁴ and sin² 2θ₂₃ > 0.87 (68% all_text_timv: First MINOS results with the NuMI beam [electronic resource]. Washington, D.C. : United States. Dept. of Energy, 2007. Oak Ridge, Tenn. : Distributed by the Office of Scientific and Technical Information, U.S. Dept. of Energy. 3 pages : digital, PDF file. text txt rdacontent computer c rdamedia online resource cr rdacarrier Published through SciTech Connect. 01/01/2007. "fermilab-conf-06-494-e" "arXiv eprint number hep-ex/0701049" Nucl.Phys.Proc.Suppl.168:195-198,2007 Contributed to Workshop on Neutrino Oscillation Physics (NOW 2006), Otranto, Lecce, Italy, 9-16 Sep 2006. Rebel, Brian J. Free-to-read Unrestricted online access star The results from the initial exposure of the MINOS detectors to neutrinos produced by the Fermilab NuMI beam are reported here. The exposure consisted of 1.27x10²° 120 GeV protons incident on the NuMI target. The data show the observation of 215 neutrinos with energies below 30 GeV while 336 ± 14.4 events were expected. The data are consistent with ν{sub μ} disappearance via neutrino oscillations with  = 2.74{sub +0.44}{sup -0.26} x 10⁻³ eV²/c⁴ and sin² 2θ₂₃ > 0.87 (68% C.L.).
